H0.text: Thrust is the force pushing the rocket when the explosion of gases creates pressure that results in the rocket's motion.

H1.text: Friction is the force that pushes the rocket when an explosion of gases creates pressure that results in the rocket’s motion.

H2.text: Stasis is the force that pushes a rocket when the explosion of gases creates pressure that results in the rocket’s motion.

H3.text: Temperature is the force pushing the rocket when an explosion of gases creates pressure that results in the rocket’s motion.

A4.text: Thrust is a reaction force described quantitatively by Newton's third law.

A5.text: A rocket is propelled forward by a thrust equal in magnitude, but opposite in direction, to the time-rate of momentum change of the exhaust gas accelerated from the combustion chamber through the rocket engine nozzle.
